moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 Nf6: I like this opening choice, steering away from the Ruy Lopez
moves.7... Be7 8. Qe2: I looked for the knight to jump to e5
I think the natural Nd2 was better
moves.21. Rg3 f5: Can't take, exposing mate on my g7. f5 protects the Bishop and allows the Queen to defend
moves.24. Nd6: take the knight, lose the game
moves.24... Rcb8 25. Ba7 Rba8 26. Bb6 Qd7: I know, take the bishop with +, yet I didn't feel comfortable leaving the 7th rank
moves.27. Rg5 Bg6 28. Nc4 Rae8 29. h4: I see the pawn threat forcing my bishop back and block my only defender of g7
moves.33. Ne5 Nxe5 34. Qxe5 Rd3+ 35. Be3: to benefit from the pin on the bishop
